programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry and Ian kick of the series with their take on a British classic, a healthy Sunday Roast before whipping up a Grilled Cheese Melt using their homemade melty cheese. Actress and film producer, Sadie Frost joins the boys for a spicy Curry House Jalfrezi. Henry and Ian share their quick and easy Snack Hacks using Avocado. To finish up they serve up an indulgent Proper Sticky Toffee Pudding.

programme.title: Ainsley's Food We Love
programme.desc: Ainsley is in his kitchen inspired by dishes for those special occasions – date nights, anniversaries, dinner parties and festivals. Ainsley starts his special menu with a Chorizo Crusted Hake on Boulangere Potatoes with Salad. Food Writer and baking enthusiast, Alex Hollywood shows Ainsley her twist on a classic dinner party favourite – Pineapple & Cinnamon Tarte Tatin. - Sabrina Ghayour is in her kitchen showing Ainsley a dish fit for any special occasion with her Marinated Steak & Pul Biber Butter. Ainsley is back in his kitchen sharing his decadent Orange Mocha Mousse with Cardamom and finishing off the menu with a classic Chicken Cordon Bleu, with Cannellini Mash & Cherry Tomatoes.

programme.title: Wall of Chefs
programme.desc: A home cook tries to rewrite the rules of mixing seafood and dairy in the Crowd-Pleaser round, and everyone tries to make magic out of the romano beans in Chef Susur Lee’s fridge.

programme.title: Flat Out Food
programme.desc: Lamb has a reputation only for fine dining but it is much more accessible than that. Jenn trims hooves, makes lamb kofte, and enjoys a slow braised leg of lamb.

programme.title: Flat Out Food
programme.desc: Jenn visits an organic grain farmer, a baker, and a whiskey maker to learn about the various uses of wheat.

programme.title: The Toque 12
programme.desc: Chef Phil arrives at the Imperial Sheraton, home of the Celestial Court and his base while he uncovers - the enormous culinary exercise that takes place every day here. We begin the Celestial Court where the decisions on - what to cook are tough but we end up with classic crispy skinned Roast Duck, Di Sum and a Wok fried Chilli Tempe thats a world beater.

programme.title: The Toque 12
programme.desc: Chef Phil isn't a natural morning person...not many chefs are...so a perfect and hearty breakfast - for him is a lavish degustation at the St.Regis in Langkawi. We are talking free flow french champagne, pass around foi gras, - caviar on blinis and smoked salmon just for starters then there's an imported lobster omelette as main course.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha's joining forces with the Queen of curries - Nisha Katona MBE for a family feast from India. Serving up Tea Steeped Chickpeas with Black Cardamom Rice for breakfast., Tardka Dhal for lunch, Nisha's Gingerbread Lamb Raan for dinner with Nadia's Carrot Halwa for dessert.

programme.title: Bake With Anna Olson
programme.desc: Chef Anna Olson bakes up some delicious tea cakes. These little teatime treats include scones, tea cookies and sweetie cakes—all small enough to fit on tea saucer.

programme.title: Bake With Anna Olson
programme.desc: Chef Anna Olson explores the world of sweet syrupy desserts. She demonstrates how makes classics from Quebec, Greece and Italy.

programme.title: Ainsley's Food We Love
programme.sub-title: Ainsley's Festive Food We Love: Christmas Special
programme.desc: This very special festive episode of Ainsley’s Food We Love is packed full of Christmas treats. Ainsley starts with his “festive bubble patties,” just perfect for a boxing day brunch. Singer and actress, Martine McCutcheon joins Ainsley as he cooks a flavourful “thai style turkey broth” that is sure to keep you warm. Old pal Brian Turner drops in and treats Ainsley to his impressive dish of “roasted poussin.” Everyone’s favourite Panto star Christopher Biggins stops by for some of Ainsley’s indulgent “chocolate panettone bread” and “butter pudding.” Drinks guru, Olly Smith serves up delicious accompaniments.

programme.desc: Henry and Ian kick of the series with their take on a British classic, a healthy Sunday Roast before whipping up a Grilled Cheese Melt using their homemade melty cheese. Actress and film producer, Sadie Frost joins the boys for a spicy Curry House Jalfrezi. Henry and Ian share their quick and easy Snack Hacks using Avocado. To finish up they serve up an indulgent Proper Sticky Toffee Pudding.

programme.title: Ainsley's Food We Love
programme.desc: Ainsley is in his kitchen inspired by dishes for those special occasions – date nights, anniversaries, dinner parties and festivals. Ainsley starts his special menu with a Chorizo Crusted Hake on Boulangere Potatoes with Salad. Food Writer and baking enthusiast, Alex Hollywood shows Ainsley her twist on a classic dinner party favourite – Pineapple & Cinnamon Tarte Tatin. - Sabrina Ghayour is in her kitchen showing Ainsley a dish fit for any special occasion with her Marinated Steak & Pul Biber Butter. Ainsley is back in his kitchen sharing his decadent Orange Mocha Mousse with Cardamom and finishing off the menu with a classic Chicken Cordon Bleu, with Cannellini Mash & Cherry Tomatoes.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry and Ian’s first dish will set your taste buds tingling with all the flavours of Thailand in their Thai-No-Fishcakes! The boys demonstrate how to transform meat free sausages into smoky chorizo for a sensational Piri Piri Vegetable Traybake, a perfect midweek super.Old friend and Michelin starred Chef, Alexis Gauthier joins Henry and Ian and shows them a vegan dish from his fine dining menu, Carrot Tartar. If you’re looking for a healthy, post-work out fix then look no further than today’s snack hacks as the guys whip up two delicious smoothies! And to finish the show Henry and Ian create their spectacular no-egg mini banoffee meringues and serve them with cashew cream and caramel sauce.

programme.title: The Chocolate Queen
programme.desc: Kirsten wows us with her scrumptious chocolate pecan pie, irresistible raspberry coconut chocolate slices, some creative and delicious meringue lollipops and the best brownie you will ever make.

programme.title: The Chocolate Queen
programme.desc: To finish the season with a sweet touch, Kirsten gets festive with a spectacular chocolate trifle recipe. She uncovers the secret to the perfect mousse cake and dishes up a mouthwatering pear, chocolate & pecan masterpiece.

programme.title: Anna and Kristina's Grocery Bag
programme.desc: Anna and Kristina serve up old-school dishes from a 1940's collection of recipes from Hollywood stars. Cocktail wieners, anyone?

programme.title: Anna and Kristina's Grocery Bag
programme.sub-title: Canyon Ranch, Nourish Indulgently Heatlhy Cuisine
programme.desc: The girls take one for the team and spend a week in a high-end spa to test a cookbook full of healing superfoods and fresh fare.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Today we’re in Belfast, and kicking off the competition are traditional Irish restaurant Holohan’s Pantry. A family affair; mum and daughter - Jane and Emir - cook up a menu of poshed up celtic favourites.
